001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.service;

003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.base.BaseComponent;
004import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.base.ComponentType;
005import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.annotations.CellFilter;
006import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.annotations.CellInsertion;
007import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.annotations.CustomCellFilter;
008import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.annotations.CustomCellInsertion;

016import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.filters.TableFilter;
017import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.insertion.CellInsertionComponent;
018import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.insertion.CellInsertionFunction;
019import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.insertion.TableInsertion;
020import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.model.CellLocator;
021import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.model.TableCell;
022import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.model.TableLocators;

024import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.components.table.sort.SortingStrategy;

054import static io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.config.UiConfigHolder.getUiConfig;

056/**
057 * Base implementation of the {@link Table} interface, providing core functionalities
058 * for reading, filtering, sorting, and inserting values into table elements in the UI.
059 *
060 * <p>This class defines an abstraction over table interactions and supports table-specific
061 * operations such as row retrieval, cell value insertion, and custom filtering.
062 *
063 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
064 */
065@SuppressWarnings("java:S3011")
066public abstract class TableImpl extends BaseComponent implements Table {
067
068   public static final String NO_LOCATOR_FOR_FIELD_EXCEPTION = "No locator found for the provided field.";
069   private static final String READING_CLASS = "Reading entire table as class '%s'";
070   private static final String READING_CLASS_WITH_FIELDS = "Reading table as class '%s' with fields %s";
071   private static final String READING_RANGE = "Reading table rows from %d to %d as class '%s'";
072   private static final String READING_RANGE_WITH_FIELDS =
073         "Reading table rows from %d to %d as class '%s' with fields %s";
074   private static final String READING_ROW = "Reading row number %d as class '%s'";
075   private static final String READING_ROW_WITH_FIELDS = "Reading row number %d as class '%s' with fields %s";
076   private static final String READING_ROW_CRITERIA = "Reading row matching criteria %s as class '%s'";
077   private static final String READING_ROW_CRITERIA_WITH_FIELDS =
078         "Reading row matching criteria %s as class '%s' with fields %s";
079   private static final String INSERT_CELL_ROW_CRITERIA =
080         "Inserting cell value in row matching criteria %s for class '%s', field '%s', cell index %d";
081   private static final String INSERT_CELL_ROW =
082         "Inserting cell value in row %d for class '%s', field '%s', cell index %d";
083   private static final String INSERT_CELL_FIELD_CRITERIA =
084         "Inserting cell value(s) into field '%s' for row matching criteria %s for class '%s'";
085   private static final String INSERT_CELL_FIELD_ROW =
086         "Inserting cell value(s) into field '%s' for row %d for class '%s'";
087   private static final String INSERT_CELL_DATA_CRITERIA =
088         "Inserting cell value(s) using data for row matching criteria %s for class '%s'";
089   private static final String INSERT_CELL_DATA_ROW = "Inserting cell value(s) using data for row %d for class '%s'";
090   private static final String FILTERING =
091         "Filtering table for class '%s' on column '%s' using strategy '%s' with values %s";
092   private static final String SORTING = "Sorting table for class '%s' on column '%s' using sorting strategy '%s'";
093   private static final String INVALID_FIELD_TYPE = "Some fields are not TableCell or List<TableCell>.";
094   private final List<Object> acceptedValues;
095   @Setter
096   protected TableServiceRegistry serviceRegistry;
097
098   /**
099    * Constructs a {@code TableImpl} instance with the specified {@link SmartWebDriver}.
100    *
101    * @param smartWebDriver The WebDriver instance for interacting with the table.
102    */
103   protected TableImpl(final SmartWebDriver smartWebDriver) {
104      super(smartWebDriver);
105      this.acceptedValues = List.of(
106            new TableCell(""),
107            List.of()
108      );
109   }
110
111   /**
112    * Constructs a {@code TableImpl} instance with the specified {@link SmartWebDriver}
113    * and {@link TableServiceRegistry}.
114    *
115    * @param smartWebDriver  The WebDriver instance for interacting with the table.
116    * @param serviceRegistry The service registry for managing table insertions and filters.
117    */
118   protected TableImpl(final SmartWebDriver smartWebDriver,
119                       final TableServiceRegistry serviceRegistry) {
120      super(smartWebDriver);
121      this.serviceRegistry = serviceRegistry;
122      this.acceptedValues = List.of(
123            new TableCell(""),
124            List.of()
125      );
126   }
127
128   /**
129    * Reads all rows from the table and maps them to objects of the specified class type.
130    *
131    * @param clazz The class type representing the table rows.
132    * @param <T>   The type of the row representation.
133    * @return A list of objects representing the table rows.
134    */
135   @Override
136   public final <T> List<T> readTable(final Class<T> clazz) {
137      LogUi.step(String.format(READING_CLASS, clazz.getSimpleName()));
138      return readTableInternal(clazz, null, null, null);
139   }
140
141   /**
142    * Reads the table with only the specified fields.
143    *
144    * @param clazz  The class type representing the table rows.
145    * @param fields The fields to be extracted from the table.
146    * @param <T>    The type of the row representation.
147    * @return A list of objects representing the table rows with selected fields.
148    */
149   @Override
150   @SafeVarargs
151   public final <T> List<T> readTable(final Class<T> clazz, final TableField<T>... fields) {
152      LogUi.step(String.format(READING_CLASS_WITH_FIELDS, clazz.getSimpleName(), Arrays.toString(fields)));
153      return readTableInternal(clazz, (fields == null) ? null : List.of(fields), null, null);
154   }
155
156   /**
157    * Reads a specific range of rows from the table.
158    *
159    * @param start The starting row index (inclusive).
160    * @param end   The ending row index (exclusive).
161    * @param clazz The class type representing the table rows.
162    * @param <T>   The type of the row representation.
163    * @return A list of objects representing the selected rows.
164    */
165   @Override
166   public final <T> List<T> readTable(final int start, final int end, final Class<T> clazz) {
167      LogUi.step(String.format(READING_RANGE, start, end, clazz.getSimpleName()));
168      return readTableInternal(clazz, null, start, end);
169   }
170
171   /**
172    * Reads a specific range of rows from the table with only the specified fields.
173    *
174    * <p>This method allows extracting a subset of rows from the table between the given indices,
175    * and retrieves only the specified fields from each row.
176    *
177    * @param start  The starting row index (inclusive, 1-based index).
178    * @param end    The ending row index (exclusive, 1-based index).
179    * @param clazz  The class type representing the table rows.
180    * @param fields The fields to be extracted from the table. If not provided, all fields are retrieved.
181    * @param <T>    The type of the row representation.
182    * @return A list of objects representing the selected rows with chosen fields.
183    * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the start or end indices are invalid.
184    */
185   @Override
186   @SafeVarargs
187   public final <T> List<T> readTable(final int start, final int end, final Class<T> clazz,
188                                      final TableField<T>... fields) {
189      LogUi.step(String.format(READING_RANGE_WITH_FIELDS, start, end, clazz.getSimpleName(), Arrays.toString(fields)));
190      return readTableInternal(clazz, (fields == null) ? null : Arrays.asList(fields), start, end);
191   }
192
193   /**
194    * Reads a single row from the table based on the row index.
195    *
196    * @param row   The row index (1-based index).
197    * @param clazz The class type representing the table row.
198    * @param <T>   The type of the row representation.
199    * @return An object representing the row.
200    */
201   @Override
202   public final <T> T readRow(final int row, final Class<T> clazz) {
203      LogUi.step(String.format(READING_ROW, row, clazz.getSimpleName()));
204      return readRowInternal(row - 1, clazz, null);
205   }
206
207   /**
208    * Reads a row that matches the provided search criteria.
209    *
210    * @param searchCriteria A list of values to match in the row.
211    * @param clazz          The class type representing the table row.
212    * @param <T>            The type of the row representation.
213    * @return The first matching row.
214    */
215   @Override
216   public final <T> T readRow(final List<String> searchCriteria, final Class<T> clazz) {
217      LogUi.step(String.format(READING_ROW_CRITERIA, searchCriteria, clazz.getSimpleName()));
218      return readRowInternal(searchCriteria, clazz, null);
219   }
220
221   /**
222    * Reads a specific row from the table, retrieving only the specified fields.
223    *
224    * <p>This method fetches a single row from the table based on its index (1-based),
225    * and extracts only the specified fields if provided. If no fields are provided,
226    * all fields of the row are retrieved.
227    *
228    * @param row    The row index to be read (1-based index).
229    * @param clazz  The class type representing the table row structure.
230    * @param fields The specific fields to be extracted from the row. If not provided, all fields are retrieved.
231    * @param <T>    The type representing the table row.
232    * @return An object representing the row with the selected fields.
233    * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the row index is out of range.
234    */
235   @Override
236   @SafeVarargs
237   public final <T> T readRow(final int row, final Class<T> clazz, final TableField<T>... fields) {
238      LogUi.step(String.format(READING_ROW_WITH_FIELDS, row, clazz.getSimpleName(), Arrays.toString(fields)));
239      return readRowInternal(row - 1, clazz, fields);
240   }
241
242   /**
243    * Reads a row from the table that matches the provided search criteria, retrieving only specified fields.
244    *
245    * <p>This method searches for a row in the table that contains all the specified search criteria.
246    * It then extracts only the specified fields if provided. If no fields are provided,
247    * all fields of the row are retrieved.
248    *
249    * @param searchCriteria A list of strings representing the criteria that must be matched within the row.
250    * @param clazz          The class type representing the table row structure.
251    * @param fields         The specific fields to be extracted from the matched row.
252    * @param <T>            The type representing the table row.
253    * @return An object representing the matching row with the selected fields.
254    * @throws NotFoundException if no row matches the search criteria.
255    */
256   @Override
257   @SafeVarargs
258   public final <T> T readRow(final List<String> searchCriteria, final Class<T> clazz, final TableField<T>... fields) {
259      LogUi.step(String.format(READING_ROW_CRITERIA_WITH_FIELDS, searchCriteria, clazz.getSimpleName(),
260            Arrays.toString(fields)));
261      return readRowInternal(searchCriteria, clazz, fields);
262   }
263
264   /**
265    * Inserts a value into a specific cell in the table row that matches the given search criteria.
266    *
267    * <p>This method locates a row in the table based on the provided search criteria and
268    * inserts the specified values into a particular field in that row.
269    *
270    * @param searchCriteria A list of strings used to identify the target row.
271    * @param rowClass       The class type representing the table row structure.
272    * @param field          The specific field within the row where the value should be inserted.
273    * @param cellIndex      The index of the cell (1-based) where the value should be inserted.
274    * @param values         The values to be inserted into the specified cell.
275    * @param <T>            The type representing the table row.
276    * @throws NotFoundException         if no row matches the search criteria.
277    * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the cell index is out of range.
278    */
279   @Override
280   public final <T> void insertCellValue(final List<String> searchCriteria, final Class<T> rowClass,
281                                         final TableField<T> field, final int cellIndex, final String... values) {
282      LogUi.step(String.format(INSERT_CELL_ROW_CRITERIA, searchCriteria, rowClass.getSimpleName(), field, cellIndex));
283      insertCellValueInternal(searchCriteria, rowClass, field, cellIndex, values);
284   }
285
286   /**
287    * Inserts a value into a specific cell within a row.
288    *
289    * @param row       The row index (1-based index).
290    * @param rowClass  The class type representing the table row.
291    * @param field     The table field to insert the value into.
292    * @param cellIndex The index of the cell in the row (1-based index).
293    * @param values    The values to be inserted.
294    * @param <T>       The type of the row representation.
295    */
296   @Override
297   public final <T> void insertCellValue(final int row, final Class<T> rowClass, final TableField<T> field,
298                                         final int cellIndex, final String... values) {
299      LogUi.step(String.format(INSERT_CELL_ROW, row, rowClass.getSimpleName(), field, cellIndex));
300      insertCellValueInternal(row - 1, rowClass, field, cellIndex, values);
301   }
302
303   /**
304    * Inserts values into multiple cells in the table row that matches the given search criteria.
305    *
306    * <p>This method locates a row in the table based on the provided search criteria and inserts values
307    * into multiple fields of that row by iterating over the fields of the provided data object.
308    *
309    * @param searchCriteria A list of strings used to identify the target row.
310    * @param clazz          The class type representing the table row structure.
311    * @param data           The object containing the values to be inserted into the corresponding row fields.
312    * @param <T>            The type representing the table row.
313    * @throws NotFoundException if no row matches the search criteria.
314    */
315   @Override
316   public final <T> void insertCellValue(final List<String> searchCriteria, final Class<T> clazz, final T data) {
317      LogUi.step(String.format(INSERT_CELL_DATA_CRITERIA, searchCriteria, clazz.getSimpleName()));
318      processInsertCellValue((fieldInvoker, strings) -> {
319         if (strings.length == 1) {
320            insertCellValue(searchCriteria, clazz, fieldInvoker, 1, strings);
321         } else {
322            for (int i = 0; i < strings.length; i++) {
323               insertCellValue(searchCriteria, clazz, fieldInvoker, i + 1, strings[i]);
324            }
325         }
326      }, clazz, data);
327   }
328
329   /**
330    * Inserts values into a specific cell in the table row that matches the given search criteria.
331    *
332    * <p>This method finds a row in the table based on the provided search criteria and inserts values
333    * into the specified field of that row.
334    *
335    * @param searchCriteria A list of strings used to identify the target row.
336    * @param clazz          The class type representing the table row structure.
337    * @param field          The specific field within the row where the values should be inserted.
338    * @param values         The values to be inserted into the specified field.
339    * @param <T>            The type representing the table row.
340    * @throws NotFoundException if no row matches the search criteria.
341    */
342   @Override
343   public final <T> void insertCellValue(final List<String> searchCriteria, final Class<T> clazz,
344                                         final TableField<T> field, final String... values) {
345      LogUi.step(String.format(INSERT_CELL_FIELD_CRITERIA, field, searchCriteria, clazz.getSimpleName()));
346      Table.super.insertCellValue(searchCriteria, clazz, field, values);
347   }
348
349   /**
350    * Inserts values into a specific cell in the table row at the given row index.
351    *
352    * <p>This method finds the row in the table based on the provided row index (1-based)
353    * and inserts values into the specified field of that row.
354    *
355    * @param row    The row index where the values should be inserted (1-based index).
356    * @param clazz  The class type representing the table row structure.
357    * @param field  The specific field within the row where the values should be inserted.
358    * @param values The values to be inserted into the specified field.
359    * @param <T>    The type representing the table row.
360    * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the row index is out of range.
361    */
362   @Override
363   public final <T> void insertCellValue(final int row, final Class<T> clazz, final TableField<T> field,
364                                         final String... values) {
365      LogUi.step(String.format(INSERT_CELL_FIELD_ROW, field, row, clazz.getSimpleName()));
366      Table.super.insertCellValue(row, clazz, field, values);
367   }
368
369   /**
370    * Inserts values into multiple cells in the table row at the given row index.
371    *
372    * <p>This method finds the row in the table based on the provided row index (1-based)
373    * and inserts values into multiple fields of that row by iterating over the fields of the provided data object.
374    *
375    * @param row   The row index where the values should be inserted (1-based index).
376    * @param clazz The class type representing the table row structure.
377    * @param data  The object containing the values to be inserted into the corresponding row fields.
378    * @param <T>   The type representing the table row.
379    * @throws IndexOutOfBoundsException if the row index is out of range.
380    */
381   @Override
382   public final <T> void insertCellValue(final int row, final Class<T> clazz, final T data) {
383      LogUi.step(String.format(INSERT_CELL_DATA_ROW, row, clazz.getSimpleName()));
384      processInsertCellValue((fieldInvoker, strings) -> {
385         if (strings.length == 1) {
386            insertCellValue(row, clazz, fieldInvoker, 1, strings);
387         } else {
388            for (int i = 0; i < strings.length; i++) {
389               insertCellValue(row, clazz, fieldInvoker, i + 1, strings[i]);
390            }
391         }
392      }, clazz, data);
393   }
394
395   /**
396    * Filters a table column based on a specified filtering strategy.
397    *
398    * @param tclass         The class type representing the table row.
399    * @param column         The table field representing the column to be filtered.
400    * @param filterStrategy The filtering strategy to be applied.
401    * @param values         The values used for filtering.
402    * @param <T>            The type of the row representation.
403    */
404   @Override
405   public final <T> void filterTable(final Class<T> tclass, final TableField<T> column,
406                                     final FilterStrategy filterStrategy, final String... values) {
407      LogUi.step(String.format(FILTERING, tclass.getSimpleName(), column, filterStrategy, Arrays.toString(values)));
408      final Map<String, List<CellLocator>> tableSectionLocatorsMap =
409            getTableSectionLocatorsMap(tclass, List.of(column));
410
411      final Map.Entry<String, List<CellLocator>> firstEntry = tableSectionLocatorsMap.entrySet().stream()
412            .findFirst()
413            .orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalStateException(NO_LOCATOR_FOR_FIELD_EXCEPTION));
414
415      final String tableSection = firstEntry.getKey();
416      final CellLocator cellLocator = firstEntry.getValue().get(0);
417
418      TableLocators tableLocators = getTableLocators(tclass);
419      SmartWebElement tableContainer = getTableContainer(tableLocators.getTableContainerLocator());
420      SmartWebElement headerRow = getHeaderRow(tableContainer, tableLocators.getHeaderRowLocator(), tableSection);
421      filterCells(cellLocator, headerRow, filterStrategy, values);
422   }
423
424   /**
425    * Sorts a table column based on a specified sorting strategy.
426    *
427    * @param tclass          The class type representing the table row.
428    * @param column          The table field representing the column to be sorted.
429    * @param sortingStrategy The sorting strategy to be applied.
430    * @param <T>             The type of the row representation.
431    */
432   @Override
433   public final <T> void sortTable(final Class<T> tclass, final TableField<T> column,
434                                   final SortingStrategy sortingStrategy) {
435      LogUi.step(String.format(SORTING, tclass.getSimpleName(), column, sortingStrategy));
436
437      final Map<String, List<CellLocator>> tableSectionLocatorsMap =
438            getTableSectionLocatorsMap(tclass, List.of(column));
439
440      final Map.Entry<String, List<CellLocator>> firstEntry = tableSectionLocatorsMap.entrySet().stream()
441            .findFirst()
442            .orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalStateException(NO_LOCATOR_FOR_FIELD_EXCEPTION));
443
444      final String tableSection = firstEntry.getKey();
445      final CellLocator cellLocator = firstEntry.getValue().get(0);
446
447      TableLocators tableLocators = getTableLocators(tclass);
448      SmartWebElement tableContainer = getTableContainer(tableLocators.getTableContainerLocator());
449      SmartWebElement headerRow = getHeaderRow(tableContainer, tableLocators.getHeaderRowLocator(), tableSection);
450      sortTable(headerRow.findSmartElement(cellLocator.getHeaderCellLocator()), sortingStrategy);
451   }
452
453   /**
454    * Sorts the table based on the given header cell and sorting strategy.
455    *
456    * <p>This method provides an extension point for subclasses to define how sorting is applied to a table.
457    * It can be overridden to implement specific sorting logic.
458    *
459    * @param headerCell      The SmartWebElement representing the header cell to be clicked for sorting.
460    * @param sortingStrategy The {@link SortingStrategy} defining the sorting direction (e.g., ascending or descending).
461    */
462   protected void sortTable(SmartWebElement headerCell, SortingStrategy sortingStrategy) {
463
464   }
465
466   /**
467    * Retrieves the table container element using the specified locator.
468    *
469    * <p>This method is protected to allow subclasses to modify or override the way the table container is located.
470    * It ensures that the SmartWebElement representing the table container is retrieved correctly.
471    *
472    * @param tableContainerLocator The locator used to find the table container.
473    * @return A {@link SmartWebElement} representing the table container.
474    */
475   protected SmartWebElement getTableContainer(By tableContainerLocator) {
476      return driver.findSmartElement(tableContainerLocator);
477   }
478
479   /**
480    * Retrieves all rows from the specified table container.
481    *
482    * <p>This method waits until all rows are visible before retrieving them. It can be overridden by subclasses
483    * to customize how table rows are retrieved.
484    *
485    * @param tableContainer   The SmartWebElement representing the table container.
486    * @param tableRowsLocator The locator used to find the table rows.
487    * @param section          The table section from which rows should be retrieved (optional).
488    * @return A list of {@link SmartWebElement} representing the table rows.
489    */
490   protected List<SmartWebElement> getRows(SmartWebElement tableContainer, By tableRowsLocator, String section) {
491      driver.getWait()
492            .until(ExpectedConditions.visibilityOfNestedElementsLocatedBy(tableContainer, tableRowsLocator));
493      return tableContainer.findSmartElements(tableRowsLocator);
494   }
495
496   /**
497    * Retrieves the header row of a table.
498    *
499    * <p>This method locates and returns the header row within the given table container. It can be
500    * overridden by subclasses to implement custom header retrieval logic.
501    *
502    * @param tableContainer   The SmartWebElement representing the table container.
503    * @param headerRowLocator The locator used to find the header row.
504    * @param tableSection     The section of the table where the header row is located (optional).
505    * @return A {@link SmartWebElement} representing the header row.
506    */
507   protected SmartWebElement getHeaderRow(SmartWebElement tableContainer, By headerRowLocator, String tableSection) {
508      return tableContainer.findSmartElement(headerRowLocator);
509   }
510
511
512   private <T> List<T> readTableInternal(final Class<T> rowClass,
513                                         final List<TableField<T>> fields,
514                                         final Integer start,
515                                         final Integer end) {
516      TableLocators tableLocators = getTableLocators(rowClass);
517      SmartWebElement tableContainer = getTableContainer(tableLocators.getTableContainerLocator());
518
519      final Map<String, List<CellLocator>> tableSectionLocatorsMap =
520            getTableSectionLocatorsMap(rowClass, fields);
521
522      final Map<String, List<SmartWebElement>> rowsMap =
523            tableSectionLocatorsMap.keySet().stream()
524                  .collect(Collectors.toMap(
525                        Function.identity(),
526                        section -> readRowsInRange(tableContainer, tableLocators.getTableRowsLocator(), section,
527                              start, end)
528                  ));
529
530      return mergeRowsAcrossSections(rowsMap, tableSectionLocatorsMap, rowClass);
531   }
532
533
534   private List<SmartWebElement> readRowsInRange(SmartWebElement tableContainer, By tableRowsLocator,
535                                                 final String tableSection,
536                                                 final Integer start,
537                                                 final Integer end) {
538      final List<SmartWebElement> allRows = getRows(tableContainer, tableRowsLocator, tableSection);
539
540      if (start != null && end != null) {
541         final int fromIndex = Math.max(0, start - 1);
542         final int toIndex = Math.min(allRows.size(), end);
543         if (fromIndex >= toIndex) {
544            LogUi.warn("Requested start/end range is invalid: {}-{}. Returning empty list.", start, end);
545            return Collections.emptyList();
546         }
547         return allRows.subList(fromIndex, toIndex);
548      }
549      return allRows;
550   }
551
552
553   private <T> List<T> mergeRowsAcrossSections(final Map<String, List<SmartWebElement>> rowsPerSection,
554                                               final Map<String, List<CellLocator>> locatorsMap,
555                                               final Class<T> rowClass) {
556      final List<T> results = new ArrayList<>();
557
558      rowsPerSection.values().stream().findFirst().ifPresent(rows -> {
559         for (int i = 0; i < rows.size(); i++) {
560            T mergedRow = null;
561            for (Map.Entry<String, List<SmartWebElement>> entry : rowsPerSection.entrySet()) {
562               final String section = entry.getKey();
563               final SmartWebElement rowElement = entry.getValue().get(i);
564
565               final T partialRow = readSingleRow(rowClass, locatorsMap.get(section), rowElement);
566               mergedRow = mergeObjects(mergedRow, partialRow);
567            }
568            results.add(mergedRow);
569         }
570      });
571      return results;
572   }
573
574
575   private <T> T readRowInternal(final Object rowIdentifier,
576                                 final Class<T> rowClass,
577                                 final TableField<T>[] fields) {
578      TableLocators tableLocators = getTableLocators(rowClass);
579      SmartWebElement tableContainer = getTableContainer(tableLocators.getTableContainerLocator());
580      final Map<String, List<CellLocator>> locatorsMap =
581            getTableSectionLocatorsMap(rowClass, (fields == null) ? null : Arrays.asList(fields));
582
583      final Map<String, SmartWebElement> rowElementMap = locatorsMap.keySet()
584            .stream()
585            .collect(Collectors.toMap(
586                  Function.identity(),
587                  section -> findRowElement(tableContainer,
588                        tableLocators.getTableRowsLocator(),
589                        rowIdentifier, section)
590            ));
591
592      T mergedRow = null;
593      for (Map.Entry<String, SmartWebElement> entry : rowElementMap.entrySet()) {
594         final T partialRow = readSingleRow(rowClass, locatorsMap.get(entry.getKey()), entry.getValue());
595         mergedRow = mergeObjects(mergedRow, partialRow);
596      }
597
598      return mergedRow;
599   }
600
601
602   private SmartWebElement findRowElement(SmartWebElement tableContainer, By tableRowsLocator,
603                                          final Object rowIdentifier,
604                                          final String section) {
605      final List<SmartWebElement> rows = getRows(tableContainer, tableRowsLocator, section);
606
607      if (rowIdentifier instanceof Integer rowIndex) {
608         if (rowIndex < 0 || rowIndex >= rows.size()) {
609            throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(String.format(
610                  "Requested row index %d is out of valid range [1..%d]", rowIndex + 1, rows.size()
611            ));
612         }
613         return rows.get(rowIndex);
614      } else if (rowIdentifier instanceof List<?> criteria) {
615         return findRowByCriteria(criteria, rows);
616      } else {
617         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unsupported row identifier type: " + rowIdentifier);
618      }
619   }
620
621
622   private SmartWebElement findRowByCriteria(final List<?> searchCriteria, final List<SmartWebElement> rows) {
623      return rows.stream()
624            .filter(row -> searchCriteria.stream().allMatch(
625                  criterion -> Optional.ofNullable(row.getText())
626                        .orElse("")
627                        .contains(String.valueOf(criterion))
628            ))
629            .findFirst()
630            .orElseThrow(() -> new NotFoundException(
631                  "No row found containing all criteria: " + searchCriteria
632            ));
633   }
634
635
636   private <T> T readSingleRow(final Class<T> rowClass,
637                               final List<CellLocator> cellLocators,
638                               final SmartWebElement rowElement) {
639      final T rowInstance = createInstance(rowClass);
640      for (CellLocator cellLocator : cellLocators) {
641         populateFieldValue(rowInstance, rowElement, cellLocator);
642      }
643      return rowInstance;
644   }
645
646
647   private <T> void populateFieldValue(final T rowInstance,
648                                       final SmartWebElement rowElement,
649                                       final CellLocator cellLocator) {
650      final By locator = cellLocator.getLocator();
651      final By textLocator = cellLocator.getCellTextLocator();
652      final String fieldName = cellLocator.getFieldName();
653      final boolean isCollection = cellLocator.isCollection();
654
655      if (!isCollection) {
656         final TableCell singleCell = buildTableCell(rowElement, locator, textLocator);
657         invokeSetter(rowInstance, fieldName, singleCell);
658      } else {
659         final List<SmartWebElement> cellElements = rowElement.findSmartElements(locator);
660         final List<TableCell> tableCells = cellElements.stream()
661               .map(elem -> buildTableCell(elem, null, textLocator))
662               .toList();
663         invokeSetter(rowInstance, fieldName, tableCells);
664      }
665   }
666
667
668   private TableCell buildTableCell(final SmartWebElement container,
669                                    final By cellLocator,
670                                    final By textLocator) {
671      final SmartWebElement cellElement = (cellLocator == null)
672            ? container
673            : container.findSmartElement(cellLocator);
674
675      final String text = cellElement.findSmartElement(textLocator).getText();
676      return new TableCell(cellElement, text);
677   }
678
679
680   private <T> T createInstance(final Class<T> clazz) {
681      try {
682         return clazz.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
683      } catch (ReflectiveOperationException e) {
684         final String message = "Could not create a new instance of class: " + clazz.getName();
685         LogUi.error(message, e);
686         throw new IllegalStateException(message, e);
687      }
688   }
689
690
691   private <T> T mergeObjects(final T t1, final T t2) {
692      if (t1 == null) {
693         return t2;
694      }
695      if (t2 == null) {
696         return t1;
697      }
698
699      final Field[] fields = t1.getClass().getDeclaredFields();
700      for (Field field : fields) {
701         field.setAccessible(true);
702         try {
703            final Object value1 = field.get(t1);
704            if (value1 == null) {
705               final Object value2 = field.get(t2);
706               if (value2 != null) {
707                  field.set(t1, value2);
708               }
709            }
710         } catch (IllegalAccessException e) {
711            final String message = "Cannot access field: " + field.getName();
712            LogUi.error(message, e);
713         }
714      }
715      return t1;
716   }
717
718
719   private void invokeSetter(final Object targetObject, final String fieldName, final Object value) {
720      if (targetObject == null || fieldName == null || value == null) {
721         return;
722      }
723
724      Class<?> paramType = value.getClass();
725      if (List.class.isAssignableFrom(paramType)) {
726         paramType = List.class; // For generics consistency
727      }
728
729      final String setterName = "set" + fieldName.substring(0, 1).toUpperCase() + fieldName.substring(1);
730
731      try {
732         final Method setter = targetObject.getClass().getDeclaredMethod(setterName, paramType);
733         setter.invoke(targetObject, value);
734      } catch (NoSuchMethodException e) {
735         final String message = String.format(
736               "Setter not found: %s(%s) in class %s",
737               setterName,
738               paramType.getSimpleName(),
739               targetObject.getClass().getName()
740         );
741         LogUi.error(message, e);
742      } catch (IllegalAccessException | InvocationTargetException e) {
743         final String message = String.format(
744               "Failed to invoke setter: %s on %s",
745               setterName,
746               targetObject.getClass().getName()
747         );
748         LogUi.error(message, e);
749      }
750   }
751
752
753   private <T> Map<String, List<CellLocator>> getTableSectionLocatorsMap(final Class<T> rowClass,
754                                                                         final List<TableField<T>> fields) {
755      final List<CellLocator> cellLocators;
756      if (fields == null || fields.isEmpty()) {
757         cellLocators = extractAnnotatedFields(rowClass, Collections.emptyList());
758      } else {
759         cellLocators = extractAnnotatedFields(rowClass, fields);
760      }
761
762      return cellLocators.stream()
763            .collect(Collectors.groupingBy(CellLocator::getTableSection));
764   }
765
766
767   private <T> List<CellLocator> extractAnnotatedFields(final Class<T> clazz,
768                                                        final List<TableField<T>> fields) {
769      final T rowInstance = createInstance(clazz);
770
771      if (!fields.isEmpty()) {
772         validateFieldInvokers(rowInstance, fields);
773      }
774
775      final Field[] declaredFields = clazz.getDeclaredFields();
776      final List<Field> validFields;
777      if (fields.isEmpty()) {
778         validFields = Arrays.stream(declaredFields)
779               .filter(f -> f.isAnnotationPresent(TableCellLocator.class))
780               .toList();
781      } else {
782         validFields = Arrays.stream(declaredFields)
783               .filter(f -> {
784                  boolean hasValue = false;
785                  try {
786                     f.setAccessible(true);
787                     hasValue = (f.get(rowInstance) != null);
788                     if (hasValue && !f.isAnnotationPresent(TableCellLocator.class)) {
789                        throw new IllegalArgumentException(
790                              "Field " + f.getName()
791                                    + " is missing a @TableCellLocator annotation."
792                        );
793                     }
794                  } catch (IllegalAccessException ex) {
795                     LogUi.error("Cannot access field: {}", f.getName(), ex);
796                  }
797                  return hasValue;
798               })
799               .toList();
800      }
801
802      final boolean validSyntax = validFields.stream()
803            .allMatch(
804                  f -> isListOfTableCell(f) || TableCell.class.isAssignableFrom(f.getType()));
805      if (!validSyntax) {
806         LogUi.error(INVALID_FIELD_TYPE);
807         throw new TableException("Invalid field type for table cell usage.");
808      }
809
810      return validFields.stream()
811            .map(this::mapToCellLocator)
812            .toList();
813   }
814
815
816   private boolean isListOfTableCell(final Field field) {
817      if (!List.class.isAssignableFrom(field.getType())) {
818         return false;
819      }
820      final Type genericType = field.getGenericType();
821      if (genericType instanceof ParameterizedType parameterizedType) {
822         final Type[] typeArguments = parameterizedType.getActualTypeArguments();
823         return (typeArguments.length == 1) && (typeArguments[0] == TableCell.class);
824      }
825      return false;
826   }
827
828
829   private CellLocator mapToCellLocator(final Field field) {
830      final TableCellLocator annotation = field.getAnnotation(TableCellLocator.class);
831      final FindBy.FindByBuilder builder = new FindBy.FindByBuilder();
832
833      final By cellBy = builder.buildIt(annotation.cellLocator(), null);
834      final By cellTextBy = builder.buildIt(annotation.cellTextLocator(), null);
835      final By cellHeaderBy = builder.buildIt(annotation.headerCellLocator(), null);
836
837      final CellInsertionComponent cellInsertionComponent = Optional.ofNullable(
838                  field.getAnnotation(CellInsertion.class)
839            ).map(ci -> new CellInsertionComponent(ci.type(), ci.componentType(), ci.order()))
840            .orElse(null);
841
842      final Class<? extends CellInsertionFunction> customCellInsertion = Optional.ofNullable(
843            field.getAnnotation(CustomCellInsertion.class)
844      ).map(CustomCellInsertion::insertionFunction).orElse(null);
845
846
847      final CellFilterComponent cellFilterComponent = Optional.ofNullable(
848                  field.getAnnotation(CellFilter.class)
849            ).map(ci -> new CellFilterComponent(ci.type(), ci.componentType()))
850            .orElse(null);
851
852      final Class<? extends CellFilterFunction> customCellFilter = Optional.ofNullable(
853            field.getAnnotation(CustomCellFilter.class)
854      ).map(CustomCellFilter::cellFilterFunction).orElse(null);
855
856      final boolean isCollection = Collection.class.isAssignableFrom(field.getType());
857
858      return new CellLocator(
859            field.getName(),
860            cellBy,
861            cellTextBy,
862            cellHeaderBy,
863            isCollection,
864            annotation.tableSection(),
865            cellInsertionComponent,
866            customCellInsertion,
867            cellFilterComponent,
868            customCellFilter
869      );
870   }
871
872
873   private <T> void validateFieldInvokers(final T instance, final List<TableField<T>> fields) {
874      for (TableField<T> setter : fields) {
875         boolean success = false;
876         for (Object testValue : acceptedValues) {
877            try {
878               setter.invoke(instance, testValue);
879               success = true;
880               break;
881            } catch (InvocationTargetException | IllegalAccessException ex) {
882               // Try next accepted value
883            }
884         }
885         if (!success) {
886            final String msg = "No accepted value could be applied via FieldInvoker. "
887                  + "Possible illegal field or setter in " + instance.getClass().getName();
888            LogUi.error(msg);
889            throw new IllegalArgumentException(msg);
890         }
891      }
892   }
893
894
895   private <T> void insertCellValueInternal(final Object rowIdentifier,
896                                            final Class<T> rowClass,
897                                            final TableField<T> field,
898                                            final int cellIndex,
899                                            final String... values) {
900      TableLocators tableLocators = getTableLocators(rowClass);
901      SmartWebElement tableContainer = getTableContainer(tableLocators.getTableContainerLocator());
902      final Map<String, List<CellLocator>> tableSectionLocatorsMap =
903            getTableSectionLocatorsMap(rowClass, List.of(field));
904      final Map.Entry<String, List<CellLocator>> firstEntry = tableSectionLocatorsMap.entrySet().stream()
905            .findFirst()
906            .orElseThrow(() -> new IllegalStateException(
907                  NO_LOCATOR_FOR_FIELD_EXCEPTION));
908
909      final String tableSection = firstEntry.getKey();
910      final CellLocator cellLocator = firstEntry.getValue().get(0);
911
912      final SmartWebElement rowElement;
913      if (rowIdentifier instanceof List<?> criteria) {
914         rowElement = findRowByCriteria(criteria,
915               getRows(tableContainer, tableLocators.getTableRowsLocator(), tableSection));
916      } else if (rowIdentifier instanceof Integer rowIndex) {
917         final List<SmartWebElement> rows = getRows(tableContainer, tableLocators.getTableRowsLocator(),
918               tableSection);
919         if (rowIndex < 0 || rowIndex >= rows.size()) {
920            throw new IndexOutOfBoundsException(String.format(
921                  "Requested row index %d is out of valid range [1..%d]", rowIndex + 1, rows.size()
922            ));
923         }
924         rowElement = rows.get(rowIndex);
925      } else {
926         throw new IllegalArgumentException("Unsupported row identifier type: " + rowIdentifier);
927      }
928
929      insertInCell(cellLocator, rowElement, values, cellIndex);
930   }
931
932
933   private void insertInCell(final CellLocator cellLocator,
934                             final SmartWebElement rowElement,
935                             final String[] values,
936                             final int cellIndex) {
937      final CellInsertionComponent component = cellLocator.getCellInsertionComponent();
938      final Class<? extends CellInsertionFunction> customFunction = cellLocator.getCustomCellInsertion();
939
940      if (component == null && customFunction == null) {
941         throw new TableException(
942               "No table cell insertion method provided for field: " + cellLocator.getFieldName()
943         );
944      }
945
946      final List<SmartWebElement> cells = rowElement.findSmartElements(cellLocator.getLocator());
947      if (cells.isEmpty() || cellIndex <= 0 || cellIndex > cells.size()) {
948         throw new TableException(String.format(
949               "Invalid cell index: %d for locator: %s", cellIndex, cellLocator.getLocator()
950         ));
951      }
952
953      final SmartWebElement targetCell = cells.get(cellIndex - 1);
954
955      if (component != null) {
956         insertUsingComponent(component, targetCell, values);
957      } else {
958         insertUsingCustomFunction(customFunction, targetCell, values);
959      }
960   }
961
962
963   private void insertUsingComponent(final CellInsertionComponent component,
964                                     final SmartWebElement targetCell,
965                                     final String[] values) {
966      if (serviceRegistry == null) {
967         throw new IllegalStateException(
968               "Your instance of table is not having registered services. You can't use CellInsertion annotation.");
969      }
970      try {
971         final Class<? extends ComponentType> type = component.getType();
972
973         Enum<?> componentInstance =
974               (Enum<?>) ReflectionUtil.findEnumImplementationsOfInterface(type, component.getComponentType(),
975                     getUiConfig().projectPackages());
976         final TableInsertion service = serviceRegistry.getTableService(type);
977         service.tableInsertion(targetCell, (ComponentType) componentInstance, values);
978      } catch (Exception e) {
979         throw new TableException(
980               "Failed to insert using component: " + component.getComponentType(), e
981         );
982      }
983   }
984
985
986   private void insertUsingCustomFunction(final Class<? extends CellInsertionFunction> customFunction,
987                                          final SmartWebElement targetCell,
988                                          final String[] values) {
989      try {
990         Constructor<? extends CellInsertionFunction> constructor = customFunction.getDeclaredConstructor();
991         constructor.setAccessible(true);
992         final CellInsertionFunction functionInstance = constructor.newInstance();
993         functionInstance.accept(targetCell, values);
994      } catch (ReflectiveOperationException e) {
995         throw new TableException(
996               "Failed to instantiate custom cell insertion function: " + customFunction.getName(), e
997         );
998      }
999   }
1000
1001
1002   private void filterCells(final CellLocator cellLocator,
1003                            final SmartWebElement headerRowElement,
1004                            final FilterStrategy filterStrategy,
1005                            final String[] values) {
1006      final CellFilterComponent component = cellLocator.getCellFilterComponent();
1007      final Class<? extends CellFilterFunction> customFunction = cellLocator.getCustomCellFilter();
1008
1009      if (component == null && customFunction == null) {
1010         throw new TableException(
1011               "No table cell insertion method provided for field: " + cellLocator.getFieldName()
1012         );
1013      }
1014
1015      final SmartWebElement targetCell = headerRowElement.findSmartElement(cellLocator.getHeaderCellLocator());
1016
1017
1018      if (component != null) {
1019         filterCellsUsingComponent(component, targetCell, filterStrategy, values);
1020      } else {
1021         filterCellsUsingCustomFunction(customFunction, targetCell, filterStrategy, values);
1022      }
1023   }
1024
1025
1026   private void filterCellsUsingComponent(final CellFilterComponent component,
1027                                          final SmartWebElement targetCell, FilterStrategy filterStrategy,
1028                                          final String[] values) {
1029      if (serviceRegistry == null) {
1030         throw new IllegalStateException(
1031               "Your instance of table is not having registered services. You can't use CellFilter annotation.");
1032      }
1033      try {
1034         final Class<? extends ComponentType> type = component.getType();
1035         final Enum<?> componentInstance =
1036               (Enum<?>) ReflectionUtil.findEnumImplementationsOfInterface(type, component.getComponentType(),
1037                     getUiConfig().projectPackages());
1038         final TableFilter service = serviceRegistry.getFilterService(type);
1039         service.tableFilter(targetCell, (ComponentType) componentInstance, filterStrategy, values);
1040      } catch (Exception e) {
1041         throw new TableException(
1042               "Failed to filter using component: " + component.getComponentType(), e
1043         );
1044      }
1045   }
1046
1047
1048   private void filterCellsUsingCustomFunction(final Class<? extends CellFilterFunction> customFunction,
1049                                               final SmartWebElement targetCell, FilterStrategy filterStrategy,
1050                                               final String[] values) {
1051      try {
1052         final CellFilterFunction functionInstance = customFunction.getDeclaredConstructor().newInstance();
1053         functionInstance.accept(targetCell, filterStrategy, values);
1054      } catch (ReflectiveOperationException e) {
1055         throw new TableException(
1056               "Failed to instantiate custom cell filter function: " + customFunction.getName(), e
1057         );
1058      }
1059   }
1060
1061
1062   private <T> void processInsertCellValue(BiConsumer<TableField<T>, String[]> action, Class<T> classType, T data) {
1063      Map<TableField<T>, String[]> invokersMap = prepareFieldInvokersMap(classType, data);
1064      invokersMap.forEach(action);
1065   }
1066
1067
1068   private <T> Map<TableField<T>, String[]> prepareFieldInvokersMap(Class<T> classType, T data) {
1069      return Arrays.stream(classType.getDeclaredFields())
1070            .filter(field -> field.isAnnotationPresent(CellInsertion.class) || field.isAnnotationPresent(
1071                  CustomCellInsertion.class))
1072            .filter(field -> isListOfTableCell(field) || TableCell.class.isAssignableFrom(field.getType()))
1073            .map(field -> {
1074               int order = field.isAnnotationPresent(CellInsertion.class)
1075                     ? field.getAnnotation(CellInsertion.class).order()
1076                     : field.getAnnotation(CustomCellInsertion.class).order();
1077
1078               TableField<T> fieldInvoker = (instance, value) -> {
1079                  field.setAccessible(true);
1080                  field.set(instance, value);
1081               };
1082
1083               String[] stringValues = convertFieldValueToStrings(field, data);
1084
1085               return new OrderedFieldInvokerAndValues<>(fieldInvoker, order, stringValues);
1086            })
1087            .sorted(Comparator.comparingInt(OrderedFieldInvokerAndValues::order))
1088            .collect(Collectors.toMap(
1089                  OrderedFieldInvokerAndValues::fieldInvoker,
1090                  OrderedFieldInvokerAndValues::stringValues,
1091                  (v1, v2) -> v1,
1092                  LinkedHashMap::new
1093            ));
1094   }
1095
1096
1097   private String[] convertFieldValueToStrings(Field field, Object data) {
1098      field.setAccessible(true);
1099      try {
1100         Object value = field.get(data);
1101         if (value instanceof TableCell cell) {
1102            return cell.getText() == null ? new String[0] : new String[] {cell.getText()};
1103         } else if (value instanceof List<?> list) {
1104            return list.stream()
1105                  .filter(TableCell.class::isInstance)
1106                  .map(TableCell.class::cast)
1107                  .map(TableCell::getText)
1108                  .filter(Objects::nonNull)
1109                  .toArray(String[]::new);
1110         }
1111      } catch (IllegalAccessException e) {
1112         throw new TableException("Unable to access field: " + field.getName(), e);
1113      }
1114      return new String[0];
1115   }
1116
1117   private TableLocators getTableLocators(Class<?> clazz) {
1118      TableInfo annotation = clazz.getAnnotation(TableInfo.class);
1119      if (annotation == null) {
1120         throw new IllegalArgumentException(
1121               "Your class: " + clazz.getSimpleName() + "is missing @TableInfo annotation for the table container");
1122      }
1123      final FindBy.FindByBuilder builder = new FindBy.FindByBuilder();
1124      By tableContainerLocator = builder.buildIt(annotation.tableContainerLocator(), null);
1125      By tableRowsLocator = builder.buildIt(annotation.rowsLocator(), null);
1126      By headerRowLocator = builder.buildIt(annotation.headerRowLocator(), null);
1127      return new TableLocators(tableContainerLocator, tableRowsLocator, headerRowLocator);
1128   }
1129
1130   private record OrderedFieldInvokerAndValues<T>(
1131         TableField<T> fieldInvoker,
1132         int order,
1133         String[] stringValues
1134   ) {
1135      @Override
1136      public boolean equals(Object o) {
1137         if (this == o) {
1138            return true;
1139         }
1140         if (!(o instanceof OrderedFieldInvokerAndValues<?> that)) {
1141            return false;
1142         }
1143         return order == that.order
1144               && Objects.equals(fieldInvoker, that.fieldInvoker)
1145               && Arrays.equals(stringValues, that.stringValues);
1146      }
1147
1148      @Override
1149      public int hashCode() {
1150         int result = Objects.hash(fieldInvoker, order);
1151         result = 31 * result + Arrays.hashCode(stringValues);
1152         return result;
1153      }
1154
1155      @Override
1156      public String toString() {
1157         return "OrderedFieldInvokerAndValues["
1158               + "fieldInvoker=" + fieldInvoker
1159               + ", order=" + order
1160               + ", stringValues=" + Arrays.toString(stringValues)
1161               + ']';
1162      }
1163   }
1164
1165
1166}
